unnormalised: Okay, so my contractor, Rajubhai, says I need "200 sq ft" of tiles for my bathroom. But my wife swears it's closer to "18.58 square meters". Whose right? Is there a secret 'Maths for Dummies' class Rajubhai's hiding from me? Also, he keeps quoting prices in "Rs/sq ft," while the tile shop guy is all about "Rs/sq meter." I’m starting to think I need a unit converter that speaks fluent Gujarati.
normalised: Okay, so my contractor, Rajubhai, says I need two hundred square feet of tiles for my bathroom. But my wife swears it's closer to eighteen point five eight square meters. Whose right? Is there a secret 'Maths for Dummies' class Rajubhai's hiding from me? Also, he keeps quoting prices in rupees per square foot, while the tile shop guy is all about rupees per square meter. I’m starting to think I need a unit converter that speaks fluent Gujarati.

unnormalised: Then there’s the cement. He wants "50 kg" of it, and I’m picturing a small mountain in my living room. Is that even reasonable for a small bathroom? Last time I tried lifting a "5kg" bag of rice, I nearly threw out my back. Someone please tell me these construction guys aren't messing with me! My brain's doing more calculations than ISRO.
normalised: Then there’s the cement. He wants fifty kilogram of it, and I’m picturing a small mountain in my living room. Is that even reasonable for a small bathroom? Last time I tried lifting a five kilogram bag of rice, I nearly threw out my back. Someone please tell me these construction guys aren't messing with me! My brain's doing more calculations than I-S-R-O.

unnormalised: And don't even get me STARTED on the sand. Apparently, "1 cubic meter" of sand is what I need. Now, I’m no architect, but that sounds like enough sand to build a small Goa in my bathroom. Are we sure he's not planning a beach-themed renovation without telling me?
normalised: And don't even get STARTED on the sand. Apparently, one cubic meter of sand is what I need. Now, I’m no architect, but that sounds like enough sand to build a small Goa in my bathroom. Are we sure he's not planning a beach-themed renovation without telling me?

unnormalised: Seriously though, I need to understand all this before I end up with a bathroom made entirely of sand and a cement mountain in my living room. Any insights into converting these measurements or whether Rajubhai is pulling my leg would be much appreciated!
normalised: Seriously though, I need to understand all this before I end up with a bathroom made entirely of sand and a cement mountain in my living room. Any insights into converting these measurements or whether Rajubhai is pulling my leg would be much appreciated!
